title: US4: SYNC vs ASYNC Blocker Handling
description: SYNC blockers pause dependent work, ASYNC blockers allow parallel progress (T035-T039)
notes: ✅ Completed T036 and T037: Implemented SYNC blocker dependency handling in LeadAgent. SYNC blockers now pause all dependent tasks (including transitive dependencies) while ASYNC blockers allow work to continue. Added comprehensive unit tests covering both blocker types. Tests verify: (1) SYNC blocks dependent tasks, (2) SYNC blocks transitive dependencies, (3) SYNC doesn't block independent tasks, (4) ASYNC allows all work to continue. Integration with multi-agent execution loop complete via can_assign_task() method.

title: Convert worker agents to async (Sprint 5)
description:
Refactor BackendWorkerAgent, FrontendWorkerAgent, and TestWorkerAgent to use async/await pattern instead of sync execution in threads.

**Background**: Current architecture uses sync execute_task() methods wrapped in run_in_executor(), which creates event loop deadlocks when agents try to broadcast via _broadcast_async().

**Goals**:
- Convert execute_task() to async in all 3 worker agents
- Use AsyncAnthropic client instead of sync client
- Replace _broadcast_async() wrapper with direct await broadcast_task_status()
- Remove run_in_executor() wrapper in LeadAgent._assign_and_execute_task()

**Benefits**:
- Proper async/await semantics
- No threading overhead
- Broadcasts work correctly
- True concurrent execution
- Better error handling and cancellation

**Files to modify**:
- codeframe/agents/backend_worker_agent.py
- codeframe/agents/frontend_worker_agent.py  
- codeframe/agents/test_worker_agent.py
- codeframe/agents/lead_agent.py (remove executor wrapper)

**Estimated effort**: 2-3 hours
**Priority**: High (architectural improvement)
**Sprint**: 5
**Depends on**: Sprint 4 P0 fix completion

**References**:
- claudedocs/sprint4-p0-final-status.md (Option 1 solution)
- claudedocs/sprint4-troubleshooting-plan.md

title: Phase 5.2: Dashboard Multi-Agent State Management
description:
Enhance Dashboard with multi-agent state management and WebSocket handling for all agent lifecycle events

Implementation Plan: specs/005-project-schema-refactoring/
- Spec: spec.md (clarified with 5 Q&A)
- Plan: plan.md (architecture decisions)
- Tasks: tasks.md (150 tasks organized by feature)

Architecture:
- React Context + useReducer for centralized state
- Timestamp-based conflict resolution (last-write-wins)
- Full state resync on WebSocket reconnection
- Support for 10 concurrent agents
- Test coverage target: ≥85%

Key Phases:
1. Reducer implementation (31 tasks)
2. Context & Hook (14 tasks)
3. WebSocket integration (28 tasks)
4. Reconnection handling (18 tasks)
5. Dashboard migration (19 tasks)
6. Performance optimization (18 tasks)
7. Polish (18 tasks)

title: Fix skipped test cases and test timing issues
description:
Several test cases were skipped during Sprint 4 implementation due to timing and mock setup issues that require deeper investigation and refactoring.

## Skipped Tests

### Dashboard Component Tests (2 tests)
1. **Loading state test** - SWR caching prevents testing of loading states
2. **No agents message test** - Mock overrides not working correctly with SWR

### Dashboard Real-time Updates Integration Tests (3 tests)
1. **Multiple simultaneous agent updates** - Agent count expectations not matching
2. **Performance test for React.memo** - Needs proper render count verification
3. **Rapid updates to same agent** - Timing expectations failing

### TaskTreeView Component Tests (2 tests)
1. **Task dependencies display** - Component not rendering task dependencies
2. **Multiple dependencies** - Same root cause as above

## Root Causes

1. **SWR Caching**: Tests interact poorly with SWR's caching mechanism
2. **Mock Timing**: mockResolvedValueOnce not overriding beforeEach mocks properly
3. **Missing Feature**: Task dependencies may not be implemented in TaskTreeView component

## Recommended Approach

1. Research SWR testing best practices and implement proper cache clearing
2. Consider using MSW (Mock Service Worker) for more realistic API mocking
3. Verify TaskTreeView component actually renders dependencies (may need implementation)
4. Add proper test utilities for controlling async timing in tests

## Files Affected

- web-ui/__tests__/components/Dashboard.test.tsx
- web-ui/__tests__/integration/dashboard-realtime-updates.test.tsx  
- web-ui/src/components/TaskTreeView.test.tsx

## Priority

P1 - These tests verify critical functionality and should be fixed before production release

title: T028-T030: wait_for_blocker_resolution() in all agents
description:
✅ COMPLETED

Implemented wait_for_blocker_resolution() method in all three worker agents:
- BackendWorkerAgent (codeframe/agents/backend_worker_agent.py:919-989)
- FrontendWorkerAgent (codeframe/agents/frontend_worker_agent.py:479-549)
- TestWorkerAgent (codeframe/agents/test_worker_agent.py:660-730)

Implementation features:
- Polls database at configurable interval (default: 5s)
- Configurable timeout (default: 600s)  
- Returns user's answer when blocker resolved
- Broadcasts agent_resumed WebSocket event on resolution
- Comprehensive error handling (ValueError, TimeoutError)

Tests: 7/7 passing (100% pass rate)
- tests/test_wait_for_blocker_resolution.py
- All 3 agents tested (Backend, Frontend, Test)
- Tests cover: answer retrieval, timeout, polling, WebSocket broadcast
